StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: NHLBI TOPMed: Pharmacogenomics of Hydroxyurea in Sickle Cell Disease (PharmHU)

Person.Organization: UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS HLTH SCI CTR HOUSTON
UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS AT CHICAGOUNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Acknowledgement Statement can be found at https://topmed.nhlbi.nih.gov/acknowledgements. In addition please include: “The TOPMed Whole Genome Sequencing Project: Pharmacogenomics of Hydroxyurea in Sickle Cell Disease (PharmHU) is a collaboration between five medical institutions. Blood samples were collected at Baylor College of Medicine for sickle cell disease research studies using internal funding. Samples were collected at Augusta University as part of the Pediatric Hydroxyurea Phase III Clinical Trial (Baby Hug) Follow-Up Observational Study II supported by the Medical College of Georgia Foundation Francis J. Tedesco Distinguished Chair held by Betty Pace, M.D. The work at Columbia University Medical Center was supported by a grant from the NIH to Columbia University from the Best Pharmaceutical for Children’s Act (3UL1RR024156-04S4) to Nancy S. Green, M.D. Emory University School of Medicine blood sample collection was supported by NHLBI grant 1U01HL117721-01. Funding for the Sickle Cell Clinical Research and Intervention Program (SCCRIP) at St Jude Children’s Research Hospital was through St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital and the American Lebanese Syrian Associated Charities (ALSAC).”
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Three consent groups are available for this study: Health/Medical/Biomedical (HMB), Disease Specific (DS), and Disease Specific and related disorders (DS-RD). For HMB: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. For DS: Use of the data is limited to Sickle Cell Disease. For DS-RD: Use of the data is limited to Sickle Cell Disease and related disorders.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical
ConsentGroup.name: HMB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Sickle Cell Disease, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-SCD-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Sickle Cell Disease and related disorders.

ConsentGroup.title: Exchange Area
ConsentGroup.name: EA
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use by NHLBI WGS study investigators only. There are three consent groups for this study: HMB, DS-SCD, and DS-SCD-RD. 1) For HMB: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. 2) For DS-SCD: Use of the data must be related to Sickle Cell Disease. 3) For DS-SCD-RD: Use of the data must be related to Sickle Cell Disease and related disorders.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Sickle Cell Disease)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-SCD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Sickle Cell Disease.
